subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription:
Marathon is an event that inculcates multiple tasks of varying difficulty covering all fields of computer science. The event tests how long one can persist solving the trickiest (and often the simplest) computer science problems thrown at them

The first round is usually a pencil and paper round where everyone is given a set of difficult questions of mathematical or logical nature and they are expected to solve them within a given time frame (usually an hour). The questions have a story around it and is fun to both read and solve those questions. The top few teams move on to the next round

subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription:
Rectify is an individual event which tests not only the mastery and familiarity with a
programming language but also the contestants dexterity in analysing problems and 
providing logical solutionsThe first round is a pencil and paper round where the participants are given a set of small 
snippets of source code and the expected output. They have to correct the mistakes / or 
point it out to solve the question.
The final round is modeled like a top coder challenge round. Contestants are given 
problems and the source code which solves the problem but has lots of bugs in it. The 
contestants solve the bugs and submit.

subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription:
Inscription is the international online programming contest of ENGINEER. It is an individual online event. It provides participants an exciting and stimulating opportunity to improve one's algorithmic and coding skills. It involves interpreting and reducing the problem statement correctly and then design on efficient algorithms to solve it. Contestants have to write working code in language of their choice as fast as possible.

In 2014 edition, the duration of the contest was 12 hours and 1000+ participants from as many as 30 countries were a part of this grand contest. The event witnessed some of Indiaâ€™s best competitive programmers (including ACM ICPC World Finalists). The participant who has solved the most number of questions in the least amount of time wins the event.

subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription: A team event where you will code and have a lot of fun doing it. Its a mix of all the things you love about computer science. There will be three rounds and each round will be a thrilling mix of coding , debugging and puzzles on the rocks. All teams will be engaged in continuous battles collecting points on there way. We will test not just your programming skills but also how much creativity and how much out of the box thinking you can pull off. This event is a treat to all the geeks out there, Kode Kombat will serve you Bugs.

subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription: We invite a speaker who is fairly reputed in the field of computer science (industry or educational field).The speaker last year was the head of the hugely popular online platform CodeChef, Anup Kalbalia part of Directi.

subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription:
mprove healthcare system of India by 'Digitizing Medical Records' issued to mothers at Primary Healthcare Centre at rural areas across India to keep track of immunization and health status. By digitizing these forms it will eventually help the Govt. to integrate medical history and enhance the patient information available to doctors enabling significantly better healthcare.

ake a look into these forms: http://hetv.org/pdf/protection-card/mcpc-english-a.pdf. (In the first half of the form, note the fields capturing personal information and dates of immunization). You will be provided a set of images (.jpeg) of these filled forms taken through CamScanner Android application. Physical forms will also be available if needed. First task is to 'extract the fields' in these forms using Image Processing Techniques. Once, significant amount of labelled fields are extracted from the forms, the Second task would be to recognize the written text (into digital text) using Machine Learning and other Data Analysis techniques. Users have access to the internet and are allowed to use any tools of their liking to solve the problem.

*Spot registrations are open

subdesc.subtitle: Overview
subdesc.subdescription:
Get your 1337 caps on, because it's time to hack! We bring to you the ECTF Teaser, with problems in cryptography, reverse engineering and general pwning. The Capture the Flag event will last for 16 hours. Teams of any size can participate. This contest is geared towards giving you the exposure you need to go in full-throttle during ECTF. You can usually find an admin or two idling on #ectf, on the Freenode IRC network. To get an idea about the contest checkout some good CTF archives of last year.
https://github.com/ctfs/write-ups-2014

Registrations will open a week before the contest on ectf.in
May the best team win!
